project.teaser: This consortium recognises the resurgence of China as a top tier great power is changing the world, and the EU needs to develop a long-term approach based on knowledge to engage strategically with the resurgent and increasingly assertive China as well as the global changes...
project.objective: This consortium recognises the resurgence of China as a top tier great power is changing the world, and the EU needs to develop a long-term approach based on knowledge to engage strategically with the resurgent and increasingly assertive China as well as the global changes unleashed thereby, including the process of selective ‘de-coupling’ and persistent US-China tension. To assist this, this consortium will bring together some of the best researchers across seven countries to work in a synergetic way to build up a world class independent knowledge base on China in Europe. We will do so by engaging in critical scientific research, nurturing a generation of younger scholars and building up a collaborative network that endures. The key subjects we will address will cover all the key areas identified in the Horizon call, namely, society and culture, politics, economy and foreign policy. Furthermore, this consortium will prioritise impact and dissemination for the EU, the corporate world, the media and the wider public across Europe. The building up of independent knowledge on a resurgent China will enable the EU to better deal with it.
project.title: Dealing with a Resurgent China
project.keywords: China, knowledge autonomy, strategic autonomy, politics, economics, foreign&security, society&culture, data-driven, conceptual analysis, networks, talent development, focus on gender, policy relevance

article.title: Preparing Europe for China as a superpower

result.title: Experts Internal Database + updates
result.description: We will create an Experts Internal Database: this database, in the form of a spreadsheet, will be early prepared for each partner to fill in with suggested experts and their affiliations. The Steering Group will then compile a long list of possible experts to be invited to join the independent EU knowledge and expertise on Contemporary China network. The full list of those who accepted – including some contact details info such as areas of expertise, affiliation(s), email addresses and links to the most recent works - will appear in a specific section of DWARC website. GDPR application will be ensured: data will be collected and handled under pre-agreed rules and protocols, according to the best practice of the field.

result.description: The PEDR will include guidelines on how to reach target groups, monitoring templates set for events, media work, etc.; communicating project concept, objectives, activities, meetings, and events to all stakeholder groups via online/offline channels; creating means to disseminate findings, and policy prescriptions to academia, policy-makers, and other stakeholders, motivating exploitation; promoting exploitation of results, methodological novelties and policy implications, both during and beyond the project lifetime, through consortium partners’ networks and ongoing activities.

"1 permanently free online database, ""Chinese party-state politics"""
result.description: We will produce a permanently free online database (“Chinese party-state politics”), intended for the policy community, researchers, and the general public of the EU, on the website of the DWARC project and partner institutions that catalogues the sources used in WP3. The database will also contain all research outputs of WP3, supplemented with brief annotations and a glossary. The database will be continuously updated.

result.title: MERICS Forum: Transatlantic coordination on China under Trump
China's Economy Data (CED) repository, available for public use M12-M36, continuous updating: complete final update by M36
result.description: We will collect, process and analyse different types of data on China’s economy. This data will then flow into a one-stop, reliable data repository and indicators platform, the China’s Economy Data (CED) repository. It will include: (a) Data on private versus state ownership of companies and their financial health. (b) Measurement of subsidies received by Chinese companies and other forms of industrial policy support. (c) Data on China’s export share across different sectors, with particular attention to those included in Made in China 2025, such as electric vehicles, semiconductors, etc. (d) Data on China’s participation in GVCs across sectors and geographies. (e) China’s Mergers and Acquisitions activity in the rest of the world with particular attention to Europe. (f) China’s overseas lending with particular attention to the EU’s neighbourhood and Africa. (g) Sentiment indicators on key issues for the Chinese economy and its global impact drawn from big data analysis (GDELT). (h) Market access indicators across different sectors of the Chinese economy.

result.title: Year 1 dissemination summary report for WP4
result.description: The report will include 2 policy briefs (3,500-5,000 words each), 1 journal article (8,000-10,000 words), 1 dissemination event for the EU policy community in Brussels, 3 podcasts (approx. 20-30 mins each), and additional policy briefs, dissemination events, and podcasts in response to major developments that impact on the Chinese economy, which we aim to deliver as soon as feasible and within two months after the major development.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
